Posts.Content: Hi all, I'm new here. My husband was diagnosed last month & is set to undergo a RP with Jay Raman at Hershey next week. I've been cutting and pasting tips from the forums but wanted to check in and get your best tips for pre and post-surgery. Thank you! ************************* The specifics: Age at diagnosis: 49 PSA: 3.2 Gleason: 3+4=7 Positive cores: 9/13 Rating: Intermediate/Favorable
Posts.Title: Husband scheduled to undergo RP next week

Posts.Content: Thanks for all the tips, I really appreciate it.
Posts.Signature: ************************* The specifics: Husbands age at diagnosis: 49 PSA: 3.2 Gleason: 3+4=7 Positive cores: 9/13 Staging: Intermediate/Favorable DaVinci RP 6/27/18 with Dr. Jay Raman (highly recommend!) at Hershey Clean margins, no disease in lymph nodes or elsewhere outside prostate
Posts.Title: Husband scheduled to undergo RP next week

Posts.Content: Thanks for all the pre and post-surgery tips. My husbands surgery went well and they found no evidence of disease outside the prostate. He had the catheter removed 7/5. The next day, he started running fevers (101) and feeling generally unwell. I spoke with the Urology resident on call, who encouraged us to come in to the ER (of course it was the evening). Husband declined. Fevers continued the next day so I called again and we went in and spent 8 delightful hours in the ER. The bloodwork looked pretty normal; slightly elevated wbc but nothing krazy. Urine test didnt show bacteria. Abdominal ct scan didnt show fluid/abscess. So eventually we were discharged. 24 hours later and hes still running fevers and now having to pee every 20-30 minutes. Has anyone else experienced this? Thoughts, recs, etc? FWIW he was inconsistent with the Miralax in the beginning and is now more backed up than the NJ Turnpike.
Posts.Signature: ************************* The specifics: Husbands age at diagnosis: 49 PSA: 3.2 Gleason: 3+4=7 Positive cores: 9/13 Staging: Intermediate/Favorable DaVinci RP 6/27/18 with Dr. Jay Raman (highly recommend!) at Hershey Clean margins, no disease in lymph nodes or elsewhere outside prostate
Posts.Title: Fevers after catheter removal

Posts.Content: PCP says it looks more like contact rash/reaction (maybe from the Depends?) Today, it has spread and definitely looks like a yeast rash. Fever of 100 yesterday. Nothing yet today fever-wise as far as I know. I encouraged h to call he surgeon directly and follow-up with him. I do think he has made progress on the bowel front.
Posts.Signature: ************************* The specifics: Husbands age at diagnosis: 49 PSA: 3.2 Gleason: 3+4=7 Positive cores: 9/13 Staging: Intermediate/Favorable DaVinci RP 6/27/18 with Dr. Jay Raman (highly recommend!) at Hershey Clean margins, no disease in lymph nodes or elsewhere outside prostate
Posts.Title: Fevers after catheter removal

Posts.Content: Urology came down to consult with us in the ER. He hasn’t contacted his particular surgeon directly. The patient is not always compliant with recommendations.... He has redness in the lower abdomen/pelvic region on the left side. We are at the PCP’s office now. They are affiliated with the major hospital that did his surgery. We’ll see. Waiting to see doctor.

Posts.Content: Thank you, I do appreciate the numerous helpful tips I received in the other thread. I’m hearing from my husband that he can’t be left alone for X days after surgery and that I should adjust my schedule accordingly but I haven’t heard that anywhere else. Just looking for input from others who have been there.
